title: DRCSIM recently stopped working with Intel graphics cards

content.raw: Since a recent update (not sure which one exactly), drcsim-nightly doesn't work with the Intel graphics card on one of our laptops anymore and segfaults (Ubuntu 12.04). Starting plain gazebo works. It will crash if a Atlas model is inserted however (while it only complains about missing ROS plugins on other computers, but will not crash). I suspect some of the recent changes related to GPU ray sensors might be responsible. The current version of drcsim (non-nightly) still works.
